paper.title: How to Convert any Digital Signature Scheme into a Group Signature Scheme
paper.abstract: Group signatures, introduced by Chaum and van Heijst, allow members of a group to sign messages anonymously on behalf of the group. In this paper we show, how any digital signature scheme can be converted into a group signature scheme. This solves an open problem posed by Chaum and van Heijst. To obtain this result, the encrypted identity of the signer is signed together with the message. The correctness of the encryption is ensured by an indirect disclosure proof that proves that the group center has the capability to decrypt the signers identity later.
